thread.title: Hawaii Tourism Authority issues final update on Hurricane Ignacio
thread.title_full: Hawaii Tourism Authority issues final update on Hurricane Ignacio

author: eTN Global Editor
title: Hawaii Tourism Authority issues final update on Hurricane Ignacio
text:
Hawaii Tourism Authority issues final update on Hurricane Ignacio   
Sep 01, 2015   
HONOLULU, Hawaii - Minimal impacts are expected as Hurricane Ignacio continues on its path northwest of the Hawaiian Islands. As of 5 a.m., Ignacio was located 335 miles east of Hana as a category 2 hurricane and is expected to continue to weaken due to increasing wind shear and become a tropical storm by Wednesday. There are currently no tropical storm watches in effect for the state. The potential impacts of the passing storm include breezy to gusty wind conditions, high surf statewide through Tuesday, and heavy rainfall through Wednesday. 
This will be the final update form the HTA regarding Hurricane Ignacio, however, we are monitoring Hurricane Jimena and will provide updates if necessary.
